moves.1. e4: This game features one of the most dangerous lines in the Sicilian Defense.
moves.2... cxb4 3. a3 bxa3 4. Bxa3: White gambits a pawn for a killer position.
moves.6... g6 7. Nf3 Bg7 8. e5: My own personal touch to this opening. Here, white has to be careful in keeping the two bishops advantage or there will be a quick defeat.
moves.8... dxe5 9. dxe5 Qxd1+ 10. Rxd1: My favorite part is Nd5. If e6, Ne4 will control e6.
moves.10... Nc6 11. Nd5 e6: I thought about Nc7 for some time asking myself if it were a checkmate.
moves.12. Nc7#: I found out it was. The moral here is to get rid of the two bishops advantage if your under attack like this and not to make position weakening moves unless necessary.
